comment:
* Helper class for generating large-format notifications that include multiple back-and-forth * messages of varying types between any number of people. * *

* If the platform does not provide large-format notifications, this method has no effect. The * user will always see the normal notification view. * *

* If the app is targeting Android P and above, it is required to use the {@link Person} * class in order to get an optimal rendering of the notification and its avatars. For * conversations involving multiple people, the app should also make sure that it marks the * conversation as a group with {@link #setGroupConversation(boolean)}. * *

* This class is a "rebuilder": It attaches to a Builder object and modifies its behavior. * Here's an example of how this may be used: * 

     *
     * Person user = new Person.Builder().setIcon(userIcon).setName(userName).build();
     * MessagingStyle style = new MessagingStyle(user)
     *      .addMessage(messages[1].getText(), messages[1].getTime(), messages[1].getPerson())
     *      .addMessage(messages[2].getText(), messages[2].getTime(), messages[2].getPerson())
     *      .setGroupConversation(hasMultiplePeople());
     *
     * Notification noti = new Notification.Builder()
     *     .setContentTitle("2 new messages with " + sender.toString())
     *     .setContentText(subject)
     *     .setSmallIcon(R.drawable.new_message)
     *     .setLargeIcon(aBitmap)
     *     .setStyle(style)
     *     .build();
     *

variables.name: MAXIMUM_RETAINED_MESSAGES
variables.comment:
* The maximum number of messages that will be retained in the Notification itself (the
         * number displayed is up to the platform).

methods.name: public void validate(Context context)
methods.comment:
* Validate that this style was properly composed. This is called at build time.
         * @hide

methods.name: public CharSequence getHeadsUpStatusBarText()
methods.comment:
* @return the text that should be displayed in the statusBar when heads upped.
         * If {@code null} is returned, the default implementation will be used.
         *
         * @hide

methods.name: public Person getUser()
methods.comment: * @return the user to be displayed for any replies sent by the user

methods.name: public CharSequence getUserDisplayName()
methods.comment:
* Returns the name to be displayed for any replies sent by the user
         *
         * @deprecated use {@link #getUser()} instead

methods.name: public MessagingStyle setConversationTitle(@Nullable CharSequence conversationTitle)
methods.comment:
* Sets the title to be displayed on this conversation. May be set to {@code null}. * *

Starting in {@link Build.VERSION_CODES#R, this conversation title will be ignored if a * valid shortcutId is added via {@link Notification.Builder#setShortcutId(String)}. In this * case, {@link ShortcutInfo#getLongLabel()} (or, if missing, * {@link ShortcutInfo#getShortLabel()}) will be shown as the conversation title * instead. * *

This API's behavior was changed in SDK version {@link Build.VERSION_CODES#P}. If your * application's target version is less than {@link Build.VERSION_CODES#P}, setting a * conversation title to a non-null value will make {@link #isGroupConversation()} return * {@code true} and passing {@code null} will make it return {@code false}. In * {@link Build.VERSION_CODES#P} and beyond, use {@link #setGroupConversation(boolean)} * to set group conversation status. * * @param conversationTitle Title displayed for this conversation * @return this object for method chaining

methods.name: public CharSequence getConversationTitle()
methods.comment: * Return the title to be displayed on this conversation. May return {@code null}.

methods.name: public MessagingStyle setShortcutIcon(@Nullable Icon conversationIcon)
methods.comment:
* Sets the icon to be displayed on the conversation, derived from the shortcutId.
         *
         * @hide

methods.name: public Icon getShortcutIcon()
methods.comment:
* Return the icon to be displayed on this conversation, derived from the shortcutId. May
         * return {@code null}.
         *
         * @hide

methods.name: public MessagingStyle setConversationType(@ConversationType int conversationType)
methods.comment:
* Sets the conversation type of this MessageStyle notification.
         * {@link #CONVERSATION_TYPE_LEGACY} will use the "older" layout from pre-R,
         * {@link #CONVERSATION_TYPE_NORMAL} will use the new "conversation" layout, and
         * {@link #CONVERSATION_TYPE_IMPORTANT} will add additional "important" treatments.
         *
         * @hide

methods.name: public int getConversationType()
methods.comment: @hide

methods.name: public int getUnreadMessageCount()
methods.comment: @hide

methods.name: public MessagingStyle setUnreadMessageCount(int unreadMessageCount)
methods.comment: @hide

methods.name: public MessagingStyle addMessage(CharSequence text, long timestamp, CharSequence sender)
methods.comment: * Adds a message for display by this notification. Convenience call for a simple * {@link Message} in {@link #addMessage(Notification.MessagingStyle.Message)}. * @param text A {@link CharSequence} to be displayed as the message content * @param timestamp Time at which the message arrived * @param sender A {@link CharSequence} to be used for displaying the name of the * sender. Should be null for messages by the current user, in which case * the platform will insert {@link #getUserDisplayName()}. * Should be unique amongst all individuals in the conversation, and should be * consistent during re-posts of the notification. * * @see Message#Message(CharSequence, long, CharSequence) * * @return this object for method chaining * * @deprecated use {@link #addMessage(CharSequence, long, Person)}

methods.name: public MessagingStyle addMessage(@NonNull CharSequence text, long timestamp, @Nullable Person sender)
methods.comment: * Adds a message for display by this notification. Convenience call for a simple * {@link Message} in {@link #addMessage(Notification.MessagingStyle.Message)}. * @param text A {@link CharSequence} to be displayed as the message content * @param timestamp Time at which the message arrived * @param sender The {@link Person} who sent the message. * Should be null for messages by the current user, in which case * the platform will insert the user set in {@code MessagingStyle(Person)}. * * @see Message#Message(CharSequence, long, CharSequence) * * @return this object for method chaining

methods.name: public MessagingStyle addMessage(Message message)
methods.comment:
* Adds a {@link Message} for display in this notification. * *

The messages should be added in chronologic order, i.e. the oldest first, * the newest last. * * @param message The {@link Message} to be displayed * @return this object for method chaining

methods.name: public MessagingStyle addHistoricMessage(Message message)
methods.comment:
* Adds a {@link Message} for historic context in this notification. * *

Messages should be added as historic if they are not the main subject of the * notification but may give context to a conversation. The system may choose to present * them only when relevant, e.g. when replying to a message through a {@link RemoteInput}. * *

The messages should be added in chronologic order, i.e. the oldest first, * the newest last. * * @param message The historic {@link Message} to be added * @return this object for method chaining

methods.name: public List<Message> getMessages()
methods.comment: * Gets the list of {@code Message} objects that represent the notification

methods.name: public List<Message> getHistoricMessages()
methods.comment: * Gets the list of historic {@code Message}s in the notification.

methods.name: public MessagingStyle setGroupConversation(boolean isGroupConversation)
methods.comment:
* Sets whether this conversation notification represents a group. If the app is targeting
         * Android P, this is required if the app wants to display the largeIcon set with
         * {@link Notification.Builder#setLargeIcon(Bitmap)}, otherwise it will be hidden.
         *
         * @param isGroupConversation {@code true} if the conversation represents a group,
         * {@code false} otherwise.
         * @return this object for method chaining

methods.name: public boolean isGroupConversation()
methods.comment:
* Returns {@code true} if this notification represents a group conversation, otherwise * {@code false}. * *

If the application that generated this {@link MessagingStyle} targets an SDK version * less than {@link Build.VERSION_CODES#P}, this method becomes dependent on whether or * not the conversation title is set; returning {@code true} if the conversation title is * a non-null value, or {@code false} otherwise. From {@link Build.VERSION_CODES#P} forward, * this method returns what's set by {@link #setGroupConversation(boolean)} allowing for * named, non-group conversations. * * @see #setConversationTitle(CharSequence)
